review.description: This place is not very good...  my husband and I stopped by here early one morning after a night out.  the corned beef hash was aweful.
review.author: A N.

review.description: Honestly I come here because me and my mom just like to have a diner experience while we are in Brooklyn and just hang out for a little bit. The dinner is not always great but breakfast is pretty good. This is a 24 hour diner located downtown off of Montague Street. A nice little local neighborhood spot. The service is decent they have TVs lots of booths usually pretty available and in the summertime they put chairs outside so that you can people watch as you enjoy a nice lunch. Nothing fancy but a typical diner that you can just enjoy hanging out it
review.author: Yas S.

review.description: Service here was wonderful, but it kind of went downhill from there. I ordered eggs Benedict and my son had pancakes with bacon. We also ordered a side of corned beef hash. The hash was disgusting and definitely out of a can. As was the hollandaise sauce that was on the eggs Benedict. My sons bacon was burned and he couldn't eat it. I love the neighborhood and the hours for this place were convenient, but we will not return.
review.author: Nikki S.

review.description: No toilet no stars, add toilet still no stars bc the chicken parmisigiana made me sad along w no toilet  also told us to pay w cash while eating which made me hangry
review.author: Syam H.

review.description: Don't waste your time here. Bunch of doofuses stealing money with garbage good and trashy service. Window indicated they accept card, yet insisted cash. Everything about this place is suspicious.
review.author: Rudy E.

review.description:
I had a free morning and I was so looking forward to having a nice breakfast alone. I saw Happy Days and immediately went inside and didn't bother to check YELP! It's breakfast... You can't really mess that up... Right??? WRONG! 

I ordered scrambled eggs and a waffle... My server was eager to help as there was no one in the diner. My food came out fairly quickly... This should have been a tip off. 

I am sent the soggiest, deformed, sad excuse of a waffle I've ever seen in my life. I even went ahead to try it despite its appearance and it was just as bad as it looked...! I paid and left... Never ever will I return. Save your money go somewhere else or if you must eat here don't order the waffle!
review.author: Melanie M.

review.description: Dis place no good :-( i came here have no good time and was not happy. They should change name to sad days diner :-( i wanted philly cheez steak but they gave me philly cheez crap. They alzo donut accept visa but they have stickers outside saying dey do accept card. Dey also have no toilets in the bathroom, only urinal so i couldn't go poo poo
review.author: Jonathan G.

review.description: I was brought up to avoid sin but also occasions of sin, i.e. places, people or things that can lead to sin. Happy Days, in common with many other similar diners is very much in my occasion of sin list. So I went there for breakfast. Twice. And yes, I sinned. Corned beef hash day 1 and bacon and eggs day 2. Massive helpings, including potatoes, good coffee and toast left me full and I resolved never to do it again. Until the next time. The decor is 1950s-redolent with some booths and tables to cater for small or largish family groups.  Wait staff are efficient and friendly and coffee refills generous and frequent.
review.author: David F.

review.description: The breakfast here is a bit over priced. It's always a hit & miss when you order the food can be great or it can be just "ok". It seems as if they make up the specials & prices as they go. For example I ordered a lumberjack to go & it clearly states on the menu "All eggs, omelette & griddle specialty platter items includes a complementary cup of coffee or tea and a small glass of juice" so after placing my order I ask the manager (who took my order) if I could get the coffee. His response was that the complementary coffee or tea only is for dining in.
review.author: Jenn V.

review.description:
Initial welcome was terrible. The server was very rude rushing us with only two people in the restaurant. It's a diner I'm not expecting much. The place is called happy days... at least smile. 

Food was mediocre but wasn't expecting much. All I got was a burger. 

If you can go to park slope go to donuts, it's worth the Uber...
review.author: Danny H.

review.description: Delivery is always comically late. They estimate 30-45 minutes and food takes 2 hours. Done wasting my time with this place.
review.author: Peter B.

review.description: Don't waste your money. I order corn beef hash and it was bad. Thanks to my friend's encouragement I asked for a refund, which they didn't hesitate with. My friend on the other hand ordered a coffee and pasta, it was only mediocre.
review.author: Samantha C.

review.description: The sign says 24 hours, but when I went in the cashier said they were closed. Funny for there were other people sitting in there.
review.author: Greg H.

review.description: Should do a better job of under promising and over delivering.  After being 45 min past the delivery time I just wished they were honest and didn't say it would only be another 10 min which turned into another 45 min.  Food arrived cold of course with no apology.
review.author: Trae H.

review.description: The food was very soggy we wait 1h30 for the delivery this was my first and last time for home deliver from this place.
review.author: Marc S.

review.description: Not even good ! My sandwich was terrible the bread was tested old ' never coming back also is very expensive!
review.author: Jack M.

review.description: Service was slow and confusing. We had multiple waiters, which made ordering weird. Then our food was just average. The home potatoes were very soggy and bland. Eggs were fine. No one tried pancakes or waffles so can't say for sure that it was all bad. At one point, a waiter took away our hot sauce to give to another table because they only had the one.
review.author: Jake V.

review.description: Best diner in the area and one of the only ones open 24 hours. They have a huge selection of food, the menu is huge, and the staff is amazing! Food also comes out very fast. Leo is the best and I love seeing him when I go in, especially after a night out!
review.author: Jasmine B.

review.description: This is absolutely the worst restaurant to order delivery food from , the guy who takes the order on the phone is very mean and has no patience and I prefer to stay hungry and never order from this place .
review.author: Nazo S.

review.description: It was my first time here and I stopped by late night on a Sunday. Seeing as it's 24 hours I wanted a chicken salad. I had just asked for a to-go container because the chicken was well seasoned. Hence the 2 stars. To my dismay about a quater of the way through I noticed the lettuce was not only dirty (it was not rinsed) but it also had a bug in it! As I looked further I realized that wasn't the only piece. Which means the cook just cut it up and put it on the plate. Who knows what I ate. Needless to say it was not the type of protein I was looking for. When I asked for the manager my request was ignored. I knew the waiter had nothing to do with the cooks actions. They insisted that I pay for unclean food and was not very accommodating considering the obvious extras in my salad.
review.author: Kiki S.
